definition: qualified/competent (professionally)/to be up to a task

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
not to be up to the task (idiom)/incompetent
competency

sentences.english: I: What experience have you had that qualifies you for this position?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么样的经验能使你胜任这个职位？

sentences.english: It was evident that her physical strength could not support her strenuous task.
sentences.chinese: 繁重的工作显然使她有些力不胜任。

sentences.english: The second part is the concrete research for the university student class cadre's competence.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是对高校学生班干部胜任力的具体研究。

sentences.english: I am afraid that his attitude to authority unfits him for work on this project.
sentences.chinese: 我但心他对当局的态度使他不能胜任这个项目。

sentences.english: I:  What experience have you had that qualifies you for this position?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么样的经验能使你胜任这个职位？

sentences.english: A: With my strong academic background, I am capable and competent.
sentences.chinese: 依我的良好学术背景，我是胜任愉快的。

sentences.english: I don't feel up to such a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 我不能胜任这样的长途旅行。

sentences.english: The instructor has competent knowledge of and experience in this course.
sentences.chinese: 教师对课程本身的专业知识与技能颇能胜任。

sentences.english: Chapter iii indicates the establishment of R&D competency model approach and the steps.
sentences.chinese: 第三章为建立研发人员胜任特征模型的方法和步骤等。

sentences.english: Do  your business carefully, tust yourself that you can competent for your job.
sentences.chinese: 做好你的工作，相信自己能胜任。

sentences.english: I'm honored, but I'm not sure I'm the right person.
sentences.chinese: 很荣幸，不过我是否胜任，可没把握。

sentences.english: For testing purposes an multi-core development machine can be sufficient for reasonably small workloads.
sentences.chinese: 如果用于测试，那么多核开发机足以胜任小的工作量。

sentences.english: After the accident, he recognized that he was not fit for the work.
sentences.chinese: 事故发生后，他认识到不能胜任这项工作。

sentences.english: Secondly, an interviewee must demonstrate his skills for the job.
sentences.chinese: 其次，应聘者要证明自己能胜任这份工作。

sentences.english: With my lusty knowledge of computers, I am learned and able.
sentences.chinese: 我有深厚的计算机知识，我可以胜任这份工作。

definition: multi-talented person/versatile person/all-rounder
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
to urge on (of horse)/to drive/to steer/to handle/to manage/to master/to dominate
able to pass muster/qualified/apt/presentable
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
heavy responsibility
to take upon oneself/to assume
to waste talent
choice of person/candidate
qualifications/experience/seniority
post/office/position
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to replace
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
